SEARCH
Package com.kneelawk.codextra.api.attach

Class AttachmentKey<A>

java.lang.Object
com.kneelawk.codextra.api.attach.AttachmentKey<A>
Type Parameters:
A - the type of thing this attaches.
public class AttachmentKey<A> extends Object
A typed key allowing things to be attached to a DynamicOps or FriendlyByteBuf.

Attachments work like stacks, allowing you to push and pop them. Getting the current attachment always retrieves the top-most value.

When attachment(s) are used in a codec, the required attachment(s) should be clearly noted in the codec's javadoc.

  • Method Details

    • ofStaticFieldName

      public static <A> AttachmentKey<A> ofStaticFieldName()
      Creates a new codec attachment key with the name of the field the attachment key is being assigned to.

      This works by using a stack-walker to find the caller class, then iterating through the static fields in initialization order to find the first one of the correct type that isn't initialized yet. This only works if this instance is to be stored in a static field in the caller class.

      Note: this won't work with Kotlin fields unless the field is annotated with @JvmStatic.

      This is intended so that users can quickly and easily know where the attachment they're missing is located.

      Type Parameters:
      A - the type this attachment attaches.
      Returns:
      the created attachment key.

    • of

      public static <A> AttachmentKey<A> of(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation name)
      Creates a new codec attachment key.
      Type Parameters:
      A - the type this attachment attaches.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of this attachment. This name is only used for printing error messages.
      Returns:
      the created attachment key.

    • push

      public <T> com.mojang.serialization.DynamicOps<T> push(com.mojang.serialization.DynamicOps<T> ops, A value)
      Pushes an attachment value to the given DynamicOps.

      Note: this may wrap the given ops and return the wrapper ops if the original ops did not support attachments. Always use the returned ops.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the dynamic ops.
      Parameters:
      ops - the dynamic ops to attach to and possibly wrap.
      value - the value to attach.
      Returns:
      the dynamic ops with the value attached.

    • push

      public void push(net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf buf, A value)
      Attaches a value to the given FriendlyByteBuf.
      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to attach to.
      value - the value to attach.

    • push

      public io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf push(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf, A value)
      Attaches a value to the given ByteBuf.

      Note: this may wrap the given buffer and return the wrapper buffer if the original buffer did not support attachments. Always use the returned buffer.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to attach to and possibly wrap.
      value - the value to attach.
      Returns:
      the buffer with the value attached.

    • getResult

      public com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<A> getResult(com.mojang.serialization.DynamicOps<?> ops)
      Gets the current value for this attachment on the given ops.

      This is intended for use in custom Codecs and MapCodecs.

      Parameters:
      ops - the dynamic ops to get the attached value from.
      Returns:
      the current value wrapped in DataResult.success(Object), or DataResult.error(Supplier) if this attachment is not present.

    • getOrThrow

      @NotNull public A getOrThrow(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf) throws io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException
      Gets the current value for this attachment on the given buffer or throwing.

      This is intended for use in custom StreamCodecs.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to get the attached value from.
      Returns:
      the current value.
      Throws:
      io.netty.handler.codec.DecoderException - if this attachment is not present.

    • attachingCodec

      public static <R> com.mojang.serialization.Codec<R> attachingCodec(Map<AttachmentKey<?>,?> attachmentMap, com.mojang.serialization.Codec<R> toWrap)
      Creates a Codec that attaches the given values to the codec context when decoding/encoding the wrapped codec.
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:
      attachmentMap - the map of attachments to attach.
      toWrap - the codec which will receive the attached values.

    • attachingMapCodec

      public <R> com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> attachingMapCodec(A toAttach, com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> toWrap)
      Creates a MapCodec that attaches the given value to the codec context when decoding/encoding the wrapped codec.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type the codec handles.
      Parameters:
      toAttach - the value to attach.
      toWrap - the codec which will receive the attached value.
      Returns:
      the created map codec.

    • keyAttachingCodecResult

      public static <K, R> com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> keyAttachingCodecResult(com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<K> keyCodec, Function<? super K,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends Map<AttachmentKey<?>,?>>> attachmentsGetter, com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> wrappedCodec, Function<? super R,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends K>> keyGetter)
      Creates a MapCodec that decodes one value and uses it to create attachments to attach to the context when decoding the other value.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type.
      R - the result type.

      attachmentsGetter - the function to turn the key into attachments.
      wrappedCodec - the codec to pass the attachments to.
      keyGetter - the function to get the key back from the result type.
      Returns:
      the created map codec.

    • keyAttachingCodecResult

      public <R> com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> keyAttachingCodecResult(com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<A> keyCodec, com.mojang.serialization.MapCodec<R> wrappedCodec, Function<? super R,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends A>> attachmentGetter)

    • mutReadAttachingStreamCodec

      public static <B1 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, B2 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, K, V> net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B1,V> mutReadAttachingStreamCodec(net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B1,K> keyCodec, Function<? super K,? extends Map<AttachmentKey<?>,?>> attachmentsGetter, ChildBufferFactory<? super B1,B2> wrappedBufferCtor, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B2,V> wrappedCodec, Function<? super V,? extends K> keyGetter)
      Create a StreamCodec that decodes one value and uses it to create attachments to attach to the context when decoding the result value, but that also allows the mutation of the attachment while encoding, making sure those changes shows up in the decoded key.
      Type Parameters:
      B1 - the buffer type of the returned stream codec.
      B2 - the buffer type of the wrapped stream codec.
      K - the key type.
      V - the result type.
      Parameters:
      keyCodec - the codec for the key to be turned into attachments.
      attachmentsGetter - the function to turn the key into attachments.
      wrappedBufferCtor - for creating the buffer used by the wrapped codec, as writing wrapped codec values to the main buffer must be delayed.
      wrappedCodec - the codec to pass the attachments to.
      keyGetter - the function to get the key back from the resul type. This may simply create a new key if the key is intended to get all its value from being mutated while encoding.
      Returns:
      the created stream codec.

    • mutReadAttachingStreamCodec

      public <B1 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, B2 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, V> net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B1,V> mutReadAttachingStreamCodec(net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B1,A> attachmentCodec, ChildBufferFactory<? super B1,B2> wrappedBufferCtor, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B2,V> wrappedCodec, Function<? super V,? extends A> attachmentGetter)
      Creates a StreamCodec that decodes one value and then attaches it to the context when decoding the result value, but that also allows mutation of the attachment while encoding, making sure those changes show up in the decoded attachment.

      This is good for things like palettes.

      Type Parameters:
      B1 - the buffer type of the returned stream codec.
      B2 - the buffer type of the wrapped stream codec.
      V - the result type.
      Parameters:
      attachmentCodec - the attachment's codec.
      wrappedBufferCtor - for creating the buffer used by the wrapped codec, as writing wrapped codec values to the main buffer must be delayed.
      wrappedCodec - the codec that will be invoked with the attachment attached.
      attachmentGetter - a function for getting the attachment when given the result type. This may simply create a new attachment if the attachment is intended to get all its value from being mutated while encoding.
      Returns:
      the created stream codec.

    • retrieveResult

      public <O, R> com.mojang.serialization.codecs.RecordCodecBuilder<O,R> retrieveResult(Function<? super A,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends R>> retriever)
      Creates a RecordCodecBuilder that acts as a field, but that only returns the retrieved value.

      When attachment(s) are used in a codec, the required attachment(s) should be clearly noted in the codec's javadoc.

      Type Parameters:
      O - the object the field will be a part of.
      R - the field type.
      Parameters:
      retriever - the function for retrieving the desired value form the attachment value.
      Returns:
      the created RecordCodecBuilder.

    • retrieveStream

      public <B extends io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf, V> net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B,V> retrieveStream(Function<? super A,? extends V> retriever)
      Creates a StreamCodec that retrieves the retrieved value.

      This function does no encoding and does not need a valid value to encode. When creating a composite stream codec, you can use FunctionUtils.nullFunc().

      When attachment(s) are used in a codec, the required attachment(s) should be clearly noted in the codec's javadoc.

      Type Parameters:
      B - the buffer type.
      V - the value type.
      Parameters:
      retriever - the function for retrieving the desired value from the attachment value.
      Returns:
      the created stream codec.

    • retrieveWithCodecResult

      public <O, R> com.mojang.serialization.Codec<R> retrieveWithCodecResult(com.mojang.serialization.Codec<O> withCodec, BiFunction<? super A,? super O,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends R>> retriever, BiFunction<? super A,? super R,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends O>> reverse)
      Creates a Codec that decodes a value and combines it with an attachment to create a result.

      When attachment(s) are used in a codec, the required attachment(s) should be clearly noted in the codec's javadoc.

      Type Parameters:
      O - the type the attachment is combined with.
      R - the result type.
      Parameters:
      withCodec - the codec for the value to be combined with the attachment.
      retriever - the function that combines the attachment with the decoded value.
      reverse - the function that gets the value to be encoded when given the attachment and the combined value.
      Returns:
      the created codec.

    • dispatchStreamCodec

      public <B extends io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf, R> net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B,R> dispatchStreamCodec(Function<? super A,? extends net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B,? extends R>> dispatcher)
      Creates a StreamCodec that dispatches based on the retrieved attachment.

      When attachment(s) are used in a codec, the required attachment(s) should be clearly noted in the codec's javadoc.

      Type Parameters:
      B - the buffer type.
      R - the result type.
      Parameters:
      dispatcher - the function for retrieving the correct codec based on the retrieved attachment.
      Returns:
      the created stream codec.

    • dispatchIfPresentCodecResult

      public <R> com.mojang.serialization.Codec<R> dispatchIfPresentCodecResult(Function<? super A,? extends com.mojang.serialization.DataResult<? extends com.mojang.serialization.Codec<? extends R>>> dispatcher, com.mojang.serialization.Codec<R> ifAbsent)
      Creates a Codec that retrieves an attachment if present and uses it to determine which codec to use or uses another codec if the attachment is absent.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the result type.
      Parameters:
      dispatcher - the function to get the codec based on the retrieved attachment.
      ifAbsent - the codec used if the attachment is not present.
      Returns:
      the created codec.
